abstract: Motion-sensitive cameras record the behavior of predators in Arctic oilfields whose numbers have soared because of the free food and the housing afforded by development.
snippet: Motion-sensitive cameras record the behavior of predators in Arctic oilfields whose numbers have soared because of the free food and the housing afforded by development.
lead_paragraph: Arctic Alaska is often described as our county's last great frontier, with its bitterly cold winters, Inupiat Eskimos on the hunt and caribou roaming the open tundra. At the same time, there is the reality of change, with oil drilling advancing, polar bears imperiled and the region's snow pack threatened by global warming.

headline.main: Arctic Predators, Caught in the Act
